section.name: Welcome to the Helianto Project
section.p: Helianto project is designed to provide easy "construction blocks" to an Hibernate+Spring+Acegi based application.

subsection.name: Project Goals

ul.li: encourage the use of dependency injection and object relational mapping,
shorten development time necessary to wire up usual persistence and service beans, like data sources, daos, transaction management, internationalization,

provide common extensible domain structure and services to meet the requirements of applications that may share user authentication and authorization across different organizations, as well as customer and supplier relationship management, production process structure and more,
provide a minimal web application template with secure access presentation layer included.

subsection.p: Goals are consistent with the mission statement (see the reference guide).

subsection.name: Creating New Projects Based on Helianto

ol.li: copy the template to start a new application and include the appropriate Helianto sub-project packages in the classpath,
create or extend domain or service beans to implement the desired functionality,
write additional O/R mappings and context definition required by the new domain or service beans,
write the presentation layer using a MVC framework of choice, as Struts, JSF, Spring or Spring Web Flow,
if using Spring Web Flow, add provided credential and access flows as plugins,
deploy the application to a servlet container.

subsection.p: Although Helianto imposes no restriction to the presentation layer, use of Freemarker and Sitemesh is encouraged.

subsection.name: Project Status
subsection.p: Helianto project is currently "work in progress".
